pullRequest.title: LivingFallEvent and PlayerFlyableFallEvent
pullRequest.bodyText:
Implements fall events from #29. One thing I am uncertain about is how I should have gone about onLivingFall(), when injecting into the methods. I have to modify two local variables at once because onLivingFall() returns a float[]. If you know of a better way, I'd like to know.  : )
I believe this will work, I tested it and it seems to do as expected.

nodes.bodyText: We should probably only fire this event once. Instead, we could store the values into fields annotated with Unique, and then access them from the ModifyVariable locations.

Suggested change *

{@link #distance} contains the distance the Entity is to fall. If this event is canceled, this value is set to 0.0F.

*

{@link #distance} contains the distance the Entity is to fall. If this event is cancelled, this value is set to 0.0F.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * Occurs when a player falls, but is able to fly.
          
          
            
             * Occurs when a player falls, but is able to fly.
          
          
            
             * {@link net.minecraftforge.event.entity.living.LivingFallEvent} will be fired for players that are not able to fly.

nodes.bodyText: I think it would be better to shadow abilities and just check it in the other mixin instead

commit.message: Shadows abilities for one method instead of two.
Changes so onLivingFall is called once instead of twice
Clean up to be compliant with checkstyle
Removes the need for cancellable in hookHandleFallDamage

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * LivingFallEvent is fired when an Entity is set to be falling.
          
          
            
             * LivingFallEvent is fired when a {@link LivingEntity} is set to be falling.
